alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued December 15 at 11:32PM PST until December 18 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility less than a quarter mile in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Harrington, Othello, Creston, Coulee City, Odessa, Quincy, Wilbur, Moses Lake, Ephrata, Grand Coulee, and Ritzville. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM PST Saturday. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Buildup of fine pollution particles can be harmful to those sensitive to air pollution including people with lung and heart problems, people with diabetes, children and the elderly.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin
